author: Special Correspondent
text:
The MTC bus, which was damaged by students, outside the Kilpauk police station on Thursday. —Photo: R. Ravindran

City police on Thursday arrested six students of a city college on Thursday on charges of celebrating Bus Day , which, the police said, is banned. According to police, students of Nandanam Government Arts College boarded a bus on the 41 D route between Avadi and Mandaveli and reportedly forced passengers to get down.

“Many of them clambered onto the roof of the bus while travelling on Poonamalee High Road. The bus conductor Shankar chided the students and asked them to get down,” said a police officer.

All of a sudden, a few youngsters, who are allegedly students of Pachayiappa’s College, pelted stones at the bus and damaged the windows. “Police arrested six students and are also searching for eight others,” said the officer. – Special Correspondent
title: Six students held for pelting stones at bus
